lines.value: Give the word, ho! and stand.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: What now, Lucilius! is Cassius near?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: He is at hand; and Pindarus is come
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: To do you salutation from his master.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: He greets me well. Your master, Pindarus,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: In his own change, or by ill officers,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hath given me some worthy cause to wish
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Things done, undone: but, if he be at hand,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I shall be satisfied.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: PINDARUS
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: I do not doubt
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: But that my noble master will appear
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Such as he is, full of regard and honour.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: He is not doubted. A word, Lucilius;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: How he received you, let me be resolved.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: With courtesy and with respect enough;
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: But not with such familiar instances,
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Nor with such free and friendly conference,
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: As he hath used of old.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thou hast described
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: A hot friend cooling: ever note, Lucilius,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: When love begins to sicken and decay,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It useth an enforced ceremony.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: There are no tricks in plain and simple faith;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But hollow men, like horses hot at hand,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Make gallant show and promise of their mettle;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But when they should endure the bloody spur,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: They fall their crests, and, like deceitful jades,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Sink in the trial. Comes his army on?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: They mean this night in Sardis to be quarter'd;
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: The greater part, the horse in general,
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Are come with Cassius.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hark! he is arrived.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: March gently on to meet him.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Stand, ho!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Stand, ho! Speak the word along.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Stand!
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Second Soldier
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: Stand!
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: Third Soldier
lines.speaker: Third Soldier

lines.value: Stand!
lines.speaker: Third Soldier

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Most noble brother, you have done me wrong.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Judge me, you gods! wrong I mine enemies?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And, if not so, how should I wrong a brother?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Brutus, this sober form of yours hides wrongs;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And when you do them--
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Cassius, be content.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Speak your griefs softly: I do know you well.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Before the eyes of both our armies here,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which should perceive nothing but love from us,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let us not wrangle: bid them move away;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Then in my tent, Cassius, enlarge your griefs,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And I will give you audience.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Pindarus,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Bid our commanders lead their charges off
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: A little from this ground.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lucilius, do you the like; and let no man
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come to our tent till we have done our conference.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let Lucius and Titinius guard our door.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: That you have wrong'd me doth appear in this:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You have condemn'd and noted Lucius Pella
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: For taking bribes here of the Sardians;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Wherein my letters, praying on his side,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Because I knew the man, were slighted off.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: You wronged yourself to write in such a case.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: In such a time as this it is not meet
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: That every nice offence should bear his comment.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let me tell you, Cassius, you yourself
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Are much condemn'd to have an itching palm;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To sell and mart your offices for gold
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To undeservers.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I an itching palm!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You know that you are Brutus that speak this,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Or, by the gods, this speech were else your last.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The name of Cassius honours this corruption,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And chastisement doth therefore hide his head.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Chastisement!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Remember March, the ides of March remember:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Did not great Julius bleed for justice' sake?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: What villain touch'd his body, that did stab,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And not for justice? What, shall one of us
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That struck the foremost man of all this world
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But for supporting robbers, shall we now
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Contaminate our fingers with base bribes,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And sell the mighty space of our large honours
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For so much trash as may be grasped thus?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I had rather be a dog, and bay the moon,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Than such a Roman.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Brutus, bay not me;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I'll not endure it: you forget yourself,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To hedge me in; I am a soldier, I,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Older in practise, abler than yourself
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To make conditions.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Go to; you are not, Cassius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I am.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I say you are not.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Urge me no more, I shall forget myself;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Have mind upon your health, tempt me no further.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Away, slight man!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Is't possible?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hear me, for I will speak.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Must I give way and room to your rash choler?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Shall I be frighted when a madman stares?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O ye gods, ye gods! must I endure all this?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: All this! ay, more: fret till your proud heart break;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Go show your slaves how choleric you are,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And make your bondmen tremble. Must I budge?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Must I observe you? must I stand and crouch
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Under your testy humour? By the gods
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: You shall digest the venom of your spleen,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Though it do split you; for, from this day forth,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I'll use you for my mirth, yea, for my laughter,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: When you are waspish.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Is it come to this?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: You say you are a better soldier:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let it appear so; make your vaunting true,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And it shall please me well: for mine own part,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I shall be glad to learn of noble men.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You wrong me every way; you wrong me, Brutus;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I said, an elder soldier, not a better:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Did I say 'better'?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If you did, I care not.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: When Caesar lived, he durst not thus have moved me.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Peace, peace! you durst not so have tempted him.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I durst not!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: No.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: What, durst not tempt him!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For your life you durst not!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Do not presume too much upon my love;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I may do that I shall be sorry for.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: You have done that you should be sorry for.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: There is no terror, Cassius, in your threats,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For I am arm'd so strong in honesty
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That they pass by me as the idle wind,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which I respect not. I did send to you
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For certain sums of gold, which you denied me:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For I can raise no money by vile means:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By heaven, I had rather coin my heart,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And drop my blood for drachmas, than to wring
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: From the hard hands of peasants their vile trash
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By any indirection: I did send
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To you for gold to pay my legions,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which you denied me: was that done like Cassius?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Should I have answer'd Caius Cassius so?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: When Marcus Brutus grows so covetous,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To lock such rascal counters from his friends,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Be ready, gods, with all your thunderbolts;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Dash him to pieces!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I denied you not.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: You did.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I did not: he was but a fool that brought
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: My answer back. Brutus hath rived my heart:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: A friend should bear his friend's infirmities,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: But Brutus makes mine greater than they are.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I do not, till you practise them on me.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You love me not.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I do not like your faults.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: A friendly eye could never see such faults.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: A flatterer's would not, though they do appear
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: As huge as high Olympus.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Come, Antony, and young Octavius, come,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Revenge yourselves alone on Cassius,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: For Cassius is aweary of the world;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Hated by one he loves; braved by his brother;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Cheque'd like a bondman; all his faults observed,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Set in a note-book, learn'd, and conn'd by rote,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To cast into my teeth. O, I could weep
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: My spirit from mine eyes! There is my dagger,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And here my naked breast; within, a heart
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Dearer than Plutus' mine, richer than gold:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If that thou be'st a Roman, take it forth;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I, that denied thee gold, will give my heart:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Strike, as thou didst at Caesar; for, I know,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: When thou didst hate him worst, thou lovedst him better
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Than ever thou lovedst Cassius.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Sheathe your dagger:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Be angry when you will, it shall have scope;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Do what you will, dishonour shall be humour.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: O Cassius, you are yoked with a lamb
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That carries anger as the flint bears fire;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Who, much enforced, shows a hasty spark,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And straight is cold again.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Hath Cassius lived
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To be but mirth and laughter to his Brutus,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: When grief, and blood ill-temper'd, vexeth him?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: When I spoke that, I was ill-temper'd too.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Do you confess so much? Give me your hand.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And my heart too.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O Brutus!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: What's the matter?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Have not you love enough to bear with me,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: When that rash humour which my mother gave me
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Makes me forgetful?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Yes, Cassius; and, from henceforth,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: When you are over-earnest with your Brutus,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: He'll think your mother chides, and leave you so.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Poet
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: [Within]  Let me go in to see the generals;
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: There is some grudge between 'em, 'tis not meet
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: They be alone.
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: [Within]  You shall not come to them.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Poet
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: [Within]  Nothing but death shall stay me.
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: How now! what's the matter?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Poet
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: For shame, you generals! what do you mean?
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: Love, and be friends, as two such men should be;
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: For I have seen more years, I'm sure, than ye.
lines.speaker: Poet

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Ha, ha! how vilely doth this cynic rhyme!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Get you hence, sirrah; saucy fellow, hence!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Bear with him, Brutus; 'tis his fashion.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I'll know his humour, when he knows his time:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: What should the wars do with these jigging fools?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Companion, hence!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Away, away, be gone.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lucilius and Titinius, bid the commanders
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Prepare to lodge their companies to-night.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And come yourselves, and bring Messala with you
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Immediately to us.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lucius, a bowl of wine!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I did not think you could have been so angry.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: O Cassius, I am sick of many griefs.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Of your philosophy you make no use,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If you give place to accidental evils.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: No man bears sorrow better. Portia is dead.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Ha! Portia!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: She is dead.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: How 'scaped I killing when I cross'd you so?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O insupportable and touching loss!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Upon what sickness?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Impatient of my absence,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And grief that young Octavius with Mark Antony
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Have made themselves so strong:--for with her death
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That tidings came;--with this she fell distract,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And, her attendants absent, swallow'd fire.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And died so?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Even so.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O ye immortal gods!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Speak no more of her. Give me a bowl of wine.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: In this I bury all unkindness, Cassius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: My heart is thirsty for that noble pledge.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Fill, Lucius, till the wine o'erswell the cup;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I cannot drink too much of Brutus' love.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come in, Titinius!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Welcome, good Messala.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Now sit we close about this taper here,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And call in question our necessities.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Portia, art thou gone?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: No more, I pray you.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Messala, I have here received letters,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That young Octavius and Mark Antony
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come down upon us with a mighty power,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Bending their expedition toward Philippi.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Myself have letters of the selfsame tenor.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: With what addition?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: That by proscription and bills of outlawry,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Octavius, Antony, and Lepidus,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Have put to death an hundred senators.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Therein our letters do not well agree;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Mine speak of seventy senators that died
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By their proscriptions, Cicero being one.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Cicero one!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Cicero is dead,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: And by that order of proscription.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Had you your letters from your wife, my lord?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: No, Messala.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Nor nothing in your letters writ of her?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Nothing, Messala.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: That, methinks, is strange.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why ask you? hear you aught of her in yours?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: No, my lord.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Now, as you are a Roman, tell me true.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Then like a Roman bear the truth I tell:
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: For certain she is dead, and by strange manner.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why, farewell, Portia. We must die, Messala:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: With meditating that she must die once,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I have the patience to endure it now.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Even so great men great losses should endure.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I have as much of this in art as you,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: But yet my nature could not bear it so.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Well, to our work alive. What do you think
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Of marching to Philippi presently?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I do not think it good.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Your reason?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This it is:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: 'Tis better that the enemy seek us:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: So shall he waste his means, weary his soldiers,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Doing himself offence; whilst we, lying still,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Are full of rest, defense, and nimbleness.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Good reasons must, of force, give place to better.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The people 'twixt Philippi and this ground
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Do stand but in a forced affection;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For they have grudged us contribution:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The enemy, marching along by them,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By them shall make a fuller number up,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come on refresh'd, new-added, and encouraged;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: From which advantage shall we cut him off,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If at Philippi we do face him there,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: These people at our back.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Hear me, good brother.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Under your pardon. You must note beside,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That we have tried the utmost of our friends,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Our legions are brim-full, our cause is ripe:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The enemy increaseth every day;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: We, at the height, are ready to decline.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: There is a tide in the affairs of men,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which, taken at the flood, leads on to fortune;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Omitted, all the voyage of their life
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Is bound in shallows and in miseries.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: On such a full sea are we now afloat;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And we must take the current when it serves,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Or lose our ventures.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Then, with your will, go on;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: We'll along ourselves, and meet them at Philippi.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The deep of night is crept upon our talk,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And nature must obey necessity;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which we will niggard with a little rest.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: There is no more to say?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: No more. Good night:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Early to-morrow will we rise, and hence.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lucius!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: My gown.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Farewell, good Messala:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Good night, Titinius. Noble, noble Cassius,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Good night, and good repose.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O my dear brother!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This was an ill beginning of the night:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Never come such division 'tween our souls!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Let it not, Brutus.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Every thing is well.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Good night, my lord.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Good night, good brother.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Good night, Lord Brutus.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Farewell, every one.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Give me the gown. Where is thy instrument?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Here in the tent.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: What, thou speak'st drowsily?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Poor knave, I blame thee not; thou art o'er-watch'd.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Call Claudius and some other of my men:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I'll have them sleep on cushions in my tent.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Varro and Claudius!
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: Calls my lord?
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I pray you, sirs, lie in my tent and sleep;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It may be I shall raise you by and by
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: On business to my brother Cassius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: So please you, we will stand and watch your pleasure.
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I will not have it so: lie down, good sirs;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It may be I shall otherwise bethink me.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Look, Lucius, here's the book I sought for so;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I put it in the pocket of my gown.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: I was sure your lordship did not give it me.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Bear with me, good boy, I am much forgetful.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Canst thou hold up thy heavy eyes awhile,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And touch thy instrument a strain or two?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Ay, my lord, an't please you.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It does, my boy:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I trouble thee too much, but thou art willing.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: It is my duty, sir.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I should not urge thy duty past thy might;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I know young bloods look for a time of rest.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: I have slept, my lord, already.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It was well done; and thou shalt sleep again;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I will not hold thee long: if I do live,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I will be good to thee.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: This is a sleepy tune. O murderous slumber,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lay'st thou thy leaden mace upon my boy,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That plays thee music? Gentle knave, good night;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I will not do thee so much wrong to wake thee:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If thou dost nod, thou break'st thy instrument;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I'll take it from thee; and, good boy, good night.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let me see, let me see; is not the leaf turn'd down
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Where I left reading? Here it is, I think.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: How ill this taper burns! Ha! who comes here?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I think it is the weakness of mine eyes
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That shapes this monstrous apparition.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It comes upon me. Art thou any thing?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Art thou some god, some angel, or some devil,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That makest my blood cold and my hair to stare?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Speak to me what thou art.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: GHOST
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: Thy evil spirit, Brutus.
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why comest thou?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: GHOST
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: To tell thee thou shalt see me at Philippi.
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Well; then I shall see thee again?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: GHOST
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: Ay, at Philippi.
lines.speaker: GHOST

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why, I will see thee at Philippi, then.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Now I have taken heart thou vanishest:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Ill spirit, I would hold more talk with thee.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Boy, Lucius! Varro! Claudius! Sirs, awake! Claudius!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: The strings, my lord, are false.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: He thinks he still is at his instrument.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lucius, awake!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: My lord?
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Didst thou dream, Lucius, that thou so criedst out?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: My lord, I do not know that I did cry.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Yes, that thou didst: didst thou see any thing?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCIUS
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: Nothing, my lord.
lines.speaker: LUCIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Sleep again, Lucius. Sirrah Claudius!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Fellow thou, awake!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: My lord?
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: My lord?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why did you so cry out, sirs, in your sleep?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Did we, my lord?
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Ay: saw you any thing?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: No, my lord, I saw nothing.
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: Nor I, my lord.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Go and commend me to my brother Cassius;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Bid him set on his powers betimes before,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And we will follow.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VARRO
lines.speaker: VARRO

lines.value: CLAUDIUS
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: It shall be done, my lord.
lines.speaker: CLAUDIUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Now, Antony, our hopes are answered:
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: You said the enemy would not come down,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: But keep the hills and upper regions;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: It proves not so: their battles are at hand;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: They mean to warn us at Philippi here,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Answering before we do demand of them.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Tut, I am in their bosoms, and I know
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Wherefore they do it: they could be content
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: To visit other places; and come down
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: With fearful bravery, thinking by this face
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: To fasten in our thoughts that they have courage;
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: But 'tis not so.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Prepare you, generals:
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: The enemy comes on in gallant show;
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Their bloody sign of battle is hung out,
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: And something to be done immediately.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Octavius, lead your battle softly on,
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Upon the left hand of the even field.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Upon the right hand I; keep thou the left.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Why do you cross me in this exigent?
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: I do not cross you; but I will do so.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: They stand, and would have parley.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Stand fast, Titinius: we must out and talk.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Mark Antony, shall we give sign of battle?
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: No, Caesar, we will answer on their charge.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Make forth; the generals would have some words.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Stir not until the signal.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Words before blows: is it so, countrymen?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Not that we love words better, as you do.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Good words are better than bad strokes, Octavius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: In your bad strokes, Brutus, you give good words:
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Witness the hole you made in Caesar's heart,
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Crying 'Long live! hail, Caesar!'
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Antony,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: The posture of your blows are yet unknown;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: But for your words, they rob the Hybla bees,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And leave them honeyless.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Not stingless too.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: O, yes, and soundless too;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For you have stol'n their buzzing, Antony,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And very wisely threat before you sting.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Villains, you did not so, when your vile daggers
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Hack'd one another in the sides of Caesar:
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: You show'd your teeth like apes, and fawn'd like hounds,
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: And bow'd like bondmen, kissing Caesar's feet;
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Whilst damned Casca, like a cur, behind
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Struck Caesar on the neck. O you flatterers!
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Flatterers! Now, Brutus, thank yourself:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This tongue had not offended so to-day,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If Cassius might have ruled.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Come, come, the cause: if arguing make us sweat,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: The proof of it will turn to redder drops. Look;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: I draw a sword against conspirators;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: When think you that the sword goes up again?
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Never, till Caesar's three and thirty wounds
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Be well avenged; or till another Caesar
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Have added slaughter to the sword of traitors.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Caesar, thou canst not die by traitors' hands,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Unless thou bring'st them with thee.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: So I hope;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: I was not born to die on Brutus' sword.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: O, if thou wert the noblest of thy strain,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Young man, thou couldst not die more honourable.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: A peevish schoolboy, worthless of such honour,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Join'd with a masker and a reveller!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Old Cassius still!
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Come, Antony, away!
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Defiance, traitors, hurl we in your teeth:
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: If you dare fight to-day, come to the field;
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: If not, when you have stomachs.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Why, now, blow wind, swell billow and swim bark!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: The storm is up, and all is on the hazard.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Ho, Lucilius! hark, a word with you.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: [Standing forth]	My lord?
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Messala!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: [Standing forth]  What says my general?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Messala,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This is my birth-day; as this very day
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Was Cassius born. Give me thy hand, Messala:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Be thou my witness that against my will,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: As Pompey was, am I compell'd to set
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Upon one battle all our liberties.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You know that I held Epicurus strong
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And his opinion: now I change my mind,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And partly credit things that do presage.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Coming from Sardis, on our former ensign
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Two mighty eagles fell, and there they perch'd,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Gorging and feeding from our soldiers' hands;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Who to Philippi here consorted us:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This morning are they fled away and gone;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And in their steads do ravens, crows and kites,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Fly o'er our heads and downward look on us,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: As we were sickly prey: their shadows seem
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: A canopy most fatal, under which
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Our army lies, ready to give up the ghost.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Believe not so.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I but believe it partly;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: For I am fresh of spirit and resolved
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To meet all perils very constantly.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Even so, Lucilius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Now, most noble Brutus,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: The gods to-day stand friendly, that we may,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Lovers in peace, lead on our days to age!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: But since the affairs of men rest still incertain,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Let's reason with the worst that may befall.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If we do lose this battle, then is this
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: The very last time we shall speak together:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: What are you then determined to do?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Even by the rule of that philosophy
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By which I did blame Cato for the death
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Which he did give himself, I know not how,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But I do find it cowardly and vile,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For fear of what might fall, so to prevent
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The time of life: arming myself with patience
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To stay the providence of some high powers
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That govern us below.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Then, if we lose this battle,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: You are contented to be led in triumph
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Thorough the streets of Rome?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: No, Cassius, no: think not, thou noble Roman,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That ever Brutus will go bound to Rome;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: He bears too great a mind. But this same day
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Must end that work the ides of March begun;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And whether we shall meet again I know not.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Therefore our everlasting farewell take:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: For ever, and for ever, farewell, Cassius!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If we do meet again, why, we shall smile;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If not, why then, this parting was well made.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: For ever, and for ever, farewell, Brutus!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If we do meet again, we'll smile indeed;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: If not, 'tis true this parting was well made.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why, then, lead on. O, that a man might know
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The end of this day's business ere it come!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But it sufficeth that the day will end,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And then the end is known. Come, ho! away!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Ride, ride, Messala, ride, and give these bills
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Unto the legions on the other side.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Let them set on at once; for I perceive
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: But cold demeanor in Octavius' wing,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And sudden push gives them the overthrow.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Ride, ride, Messala: let them all come down.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O, look, Titinius, look, the villains fly!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Myself have to mine own turn'd enemy:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This ensign here of mine was turning back;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: I slew the coward, and did take it from him.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: O Cassius, Brutus gave the word too early;
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Who, having some advantage on Octavius,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Took it too eagerly: his soldiers fell to spoil,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Whilst we by Antony are all enclosed.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: PINDARUS
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Fly further off, my lord, fly further off;
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Mark Antony is in your tents, my lord
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Fly, therefore, noble Cassius, fly far off.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This hill is far enough. Look, look, Titinius;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Are those my tents where I perceive the fire?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: They are, my lord.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Titinius, if thou lovest me,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Mount thou my horse, and hide thy spurs in him,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Till he have brought thee up to yonder troops,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And here again; that I may rest assured
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Whether yond troops are friend or enemy.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: I will be here again, even with a thought.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Go, Pindarus, get higher on that hill;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: My sight was ever thick; regard Titinius,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And tell me what thou notest about the field.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: This day I breathed first: time is come round,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And where I did begin, there shall I end;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: My life is run his compass. Sirrah, what news?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: PINDARUS
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: [Above]  O my lord!
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: What news?
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: PINDARUS
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: [Above]  Titinius is enclosed round about
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: With horsemen, that make to him on the spur;
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Yet he spurs on. Now they are almost on him.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Now, Titinius! Now some light. O, he lights too.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: He's ta'en.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: And, hark! they shout for joy.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: CASSIUS
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Come down, behold no more.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: O, coward that I am, to live so long,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: To see my best friend ta'en before my face!
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Come hither, sirrah:
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: In Parthia did I take thee prisoner;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And then I swore thee, saving of thy life,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: That whatsoever I did bid thee do,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Thou shouldst attempt it. Come now, keep thine oath;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Now be a freeman: and with this good sword,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: That ran through Caesar's bowels, search this bosom.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Stand not to answer: here, take thou the hilts;
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: And, when my face is cover'd, as 'tis now,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Guide thou the sword.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Caesar, thou art revenged,
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: Even with the sword that kill'd thee.
lines.speaker: CASSIUS

lines.value: PINDARUS
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: So, I am free; yet would not so have been,
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Durst I have done my will. O Cassius,
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Far from this country Pindarus shall run,
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: Where never Roman shall take note of him.
lines.speaker: PINDARUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: It is but change, Titinius; for Octavius
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Is overthrown by noble Brutus' power,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: As Cassius' legions are by Antony.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: These tidings will well comfort Cassius.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Where did you leave him?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: All disconsolate,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: With Pindarus his bondman, on this hill.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Is not that he t hat lies upon the ground?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: He lies not like the living. O my heart!
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Is not that he?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: No, this was he, Messala,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: But Cassius is no more. O setting sun,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: As in thy red rays thou dost sink to-night,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: So in his red blood Cassius' day is set;
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: The sun of Rome is set! Our day is gone;
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Clouds, dews, and dangers come; our deeds are done!
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Mistrust of my success hath done this deed.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Mistrust of good success hath done this deed.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: O hateful error, melancholy's child,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Why dost thou show to the apt thoughts of men
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: The things that are not? O error, soon conceived,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Thou never comest unto a happy birth,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: But kill'st the mother that engender'd thee!
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: What, Pindarus! where art thou, Pindarus?
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Seek him, Titinius, whilst I go to meet
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: The noble Brutus, thrusting this report
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Into his ears; I may say, thrusting it;
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: For piercing steel and darts envenomed
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Shall be as welcome to the ears of Brutus
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: As tidings of this sight.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: TITINIUS
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Hie you, Messala,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: And I will seek for Pindarus the while.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Why didst thou send me forth, brave Cassius?
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Did I not meet thy friends? and did not they
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Put on my brows this wreath of victory,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: And bid me give it thee? Didst thou not hear their shouts?
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Alas, thou hast misconstrued every thing!
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: But, hold thee, take this garland on thy brow;
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Thy Brutus bid me give it thee, and I
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Will do his bidding. Brutus, come apace,
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: And see how I regarded Caius Cassius.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: By your leave, gods:--this is a Roman's part
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: Come, Cassius' sword, and find Titinius' heart.
lines.speaker: TITINIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Where, where, Messala, doth his body lie?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Lo, yonder, and Titinius mourning it.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Titinius' face is upward.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CATO
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: He is slain.
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: O Julius Caesar, thou art mighty yet!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thy spirit walks abroad and turns our swords
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: In our own proper entrails.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CATO
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: Brave Titinius!
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: Look, whether he have not crown'd dead Cassius!
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Are yet two Romans living such as these?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The last of all the Romans, fare thee well!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It is impossible that ever Rome
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Should breed thy fellow. Friends, I owe more tears
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: To this dead man than you shall see me pay.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I shall find time, Cassius, I shall find time.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come, therefore, and to Thasos send his body:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: His funerals shall not be in our camp,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Lest it discomfort us. Lucilius, come;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And come, young Cato; let us to the field.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Labeo and Flavius, set our battles on:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: 'Tis three o'clock; and, Romans, yet ere night
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: We shall try fortune in a second fight.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Yet, countrymen, O, yet hold up your heads!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CATO
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: What bastard doth not? Who will go with me?
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: I will proclaim my name about the field:
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: A foe to tyrants, and my country's friend;
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: I am the son of Marcus Cato, ho!
lines.speaker: CATO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And I am Brutus, Marcus Brutus, I;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Brutus, my country's friend; know me for Brutus!
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: O young and noble Cato, art thou down?
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Why, now thou diest as bravely as Titinius;
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: And mayst be honour'd, being Cato's son.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Yield, or thou diest.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Only I yield to die:
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: There is so much that thou wilt kill me straight;
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Kill Brutus, and be honour'd in his death.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: We must not. A noble prisoner!
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Second Soldier
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: Room, ho! Tell Antony, Brutus is ta'en.
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: I'll tell the news. Here comes the general.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Brutus is ta'en, Brutus is ta'en, my lord.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Where is he?
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Safe, Antony; Brutus is safe enough:
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: I dare assure thee that no enemy
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: Shall ever take alive the noble Brutus:
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: The gods defend him from so great a shame!
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: When you do find him, or alive or dead,
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: He will be found like Brutus, like himself.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: This is not Brutus, friend; but, I assure you,
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: A prize no less in worth: keep this man safe;
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Give him all kindness: I had rather have
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Such men my friends than enemies. Go on,
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: And see whether Brutus be alive or dead;
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: And bring us word unto Octavius' tent
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: How every thing is chanced.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come, poor remains of friends, rest on this rock.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: Statilius show'd the torch-light, but, my lord,
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: He came not back: he is or ta'en or slain.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Sit thee down, Clitus: slaying is the word;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It is a deed in fashion. Hark thee, Clitus.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: What, I, my lord? No, not for all the world.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Peace then! no words.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: I'll rather kill myself.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hark thee, Dardanius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: DARDANIUS
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: Shall I do such a deed?
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: O Dardanius!
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: DARDANIUS
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: O Clitus!
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: What ill request did Brutus make to thee?
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: DARDANIUS
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: To kill him, Clitus. Look, he meditates.
lines.speaker: DARDANIUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: Now is that noble vessel full of grief,
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: That it runs over even at his eyes.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Come hither, good Volumnius; list a word.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VOLUMNIUS
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: What says my lord?
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Why, this, Volumnius:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: The ghost of Caesar hath appear'd to me
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Two several times by night; at Sardis once,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: And, this last night, here in Philippi fields:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I know my hour is come.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VOLUMNIUS
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: Not so, my lord.
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Nay, I am sure it is, Volumnius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thou seest the world, Volumnius, how it goes;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Our enemies have beat us to the pit:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It is more worthy to leap in ourselves,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Than tarry till they push us. Good Volumnius,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thou know'st that we two went to school together:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Even for that our love of old, I prithee,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hold thou my sword-hilts, whilst I run on it.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: VOLUMNIUS
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: That's not an office for a friend, my lord.
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: Fly, fly, my lord; there is no tarrying here.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Farewell to you; and you; and you, Volumnius.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Strato, thou hast been all this while asleep;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Farewell to thee too, Strato. Countrymen,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: My heart doth joy that yet in all my life
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I found no man but he was true to me.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I shall have glory by this losing day
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: More than Octavius and Mark Antony
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: By this vile conquest shall attain unto.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: So fare you well at once; for Brutus' tongue
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hath almost ended his life's history:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Night hangs upon mine eyes; my bones would rest,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That have but labour'd to attain this hour.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: CLITUS
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: Fly, my lord, fly.
lines.speaker: CLITUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hence! I will follow.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I prithee, Strato, stay thou by thy lord:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thou art a fellow of a good respect;
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Thy life hath had some smatch of honour in it:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Hold then my sword, and turn away thy face,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: While I do run upon it. Wilt thou, Strato?
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: STRATO
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: Give me your hand first. Fare you well, my lord.
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Farewell, good Strato.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Caesar, now be still:
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I kill'd not thee with half so good a will.
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: What man is that?
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: My master's man. Strato, where is thy master?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: STRATO
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: Free from the bondage you are in, Messala:
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: The conquerors can but make a fire of him;
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: For Brutus only overcame himself,
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: And no man else hath honour by his death.
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: LUCILIUS
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: So Brutus should be found. I thank thee, Brutus,
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: That thou hast proved Lucilius' saying true.
lines.speaker: LUCILIUS

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: All that served Brutus, I will entertain them.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Fellow, wilt thou bestow thy time with me?
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: STRATO
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: Ay, if Messala will prefer me to you.
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Do so, good Messala.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: How died my master, Strato?
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: STRATO
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: I held the sword, and he did run on it.
lines.speaker: STRATO

lines.value: MESSALA
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: Octavius, then take him to follow thee,
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: That did the latest service to my master.
lines.speaker: MESSALA

lines.value: ANTONY
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: This was the noblest Roman of them all:
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: All the conspirators save only he
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: Did that they did in envy of great Caesar;
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: He only, in a general honest thought
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: And common good to all, made one of them.
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: His life was gentle, and the elements
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: So mix'd in him that Nature might stand up
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: And say to all the world 'This was a man!'
lines.speaker: ANTONY

lines.value: OCTAVIUS
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: According to his virtue let us use him,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: With all respect and rites of burial.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Within my tent his bones to-night shall lie,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: Most like a soldier, order'd honourably.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: So call the field to rest; and let's away,
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS

lines.value: To part the glories of this happy day.
lines.speaker: OCTAVIUS
